question:
Which of the following are the features of Islamic Architecture in India?
  1. Tall minarets
  2. Double dome structure
  3. Cenotaphs
Select the correct option from codes given below:
explanation: Tall minarets were the significant and one of the earliest features of Islamic architecture. A double dome is built of two layers. One layer inside which provides ceiling to the interior of the building and the other layer is the outer one which crowns the buildings. The method of making double dome was practised in East Asia for quite some time before it was imported into India. A cenotaph is an empty tomb or a monument erected in honour of a person or group of people whose remains are elsewhere.
